subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4.0 release candidate 2 Test.None
msgSnippet: ... It isn t packaged-scope... in Java, members of an interface always have the same visibility as the interface itself (in this case, public). -- Software is
messageBody:
On 22/01/06, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
> Another way to say this is that we needed a Null Object to represent the case where there is no expected exception and you can't use null as a default value. Test.None is package scope, so it shouldn't be publicly accessible, or am I missing something?

It isn't packaged-scope... in Java, members of an interface always
have the same visibility as the interface itself (in this case,
public).

--
"Software is too expensive to build cheaply"
Robert Watkins http://twasink.net/ robertdw@...
